title: jokers10
author: jokers10
content: I saw many AI posters in Combo subscription campaign and one day decided to go through all its participants. And I found several users who have the same pattern of posting: usually one sentence split into three rows. It looked like they are all the parts of one big low quality posting alt account farm. Combo campaign prohibits alt account participation. So this is a violation.Same writing style makes it nearly obvious that it is a farm, but it is not a proof by itself. So I decided to go through their blockchain addresses. If to look at their bitcoin addresses, then many of accounts which have any transactions have an interconnection through using the same Fixed Float exchange, but they have different addresses for this exchange, so I don't think this proof is good enough.But there are interconnections through Ethereum addresses for 5 of 8 campaign participants and one more account not from campaign.I marked accounts for which I don't yet see good proofs with grey.If any hints on how to find other accounts of this farm or how to find proofs for accounts that I didn't find interconnections except writing style yet, it would be good.↔️lunnatic — Combo — archive.org↔️Desscount — Combo —archive.org↔️Inspiron14 — Combo —archive.orgjudaspriest — Combo —archive.org↔️Smitty Werben Man Jensen — Combo —archive.orgSaveOurSea — Combo —archive.orgwaONE — Combo —archive.org↔️CapGelatik — Combo —archive.org-----↔️GelatikKembarlunnatic↔️0x2873F28e551F270338EA4de73189f7F18e3d141A — proof — archive.orghas transactions to 0x53625aff45021d961900dadbeb1535b92f2cd00d, interconnected with:1. 0x2087500147d070dec3187ad84426cb16858d9e6e, Desscount2. 0x873A6dE20E76a7C55E0c6e3241553977158deB81, Inspiron14Desscount↔️0x2087500147d070dec3187ad84426cb16858d9e6e — proof —archive.orghas transactions to 0x53625aff45021d961900dadbeb1535b92f2cd00d, interconnected with:1. 0x2873F28e551F270338EA4de73189f7F18e3d141A, lunnatic2. 0x873A6dE20E76a7C55E0c6e3241553977158deB81, Inspiron14Inspiron14↔️0x446bF788446B40Ca07e42fb1986c4366e46302A2 — proof —archive.orgused by GelatikKembar also↔️0x6e50e0Cf3A42180F497d44113D7F897313573FB3 — proof —archive.orgused by CapGelatik also↔️0x873A6dE20E76a7C55E0c6e3241553977158deB81 — proof —archive.orghas transactions to 0x53625aff45021d961900dadbeb1535b92f2cd00d, interconnected with:1. 0x2873F28e551F270338EA4de73189f7F18e3d141A, lunnatic2. 0x2087500147d070dec3187ad84426cb16858d9e6e, DesscountSmitty Werben Man Jensen↔️0xf7d2836418B055567c9F34e45080baa50955a638 — proof —archive.orghas transactions to 0x4d97326518a5fabf299dac021ea1101e4b9be318, interconnected with:1. 0x618E9257d2eeaAbc98B7137e91751F334Abd8911, CapGelatikCapGelatik↔️0x618E9257d2eeaAbc98B7137e91751F334Abd8911 — proof —archive.orghas transactions to 0x4d97326518a5fabf299dac021ea1101e4b9be318, interconnected with:1. 0xf7d2836418B055567c9F34e45080baa50955a638, Smitty Werben Man Jensen↔️0x6e50e0Cf3A42180F497d44113D7F897313573FB3 — proof —archive.orgused by Inspiron14 alsoGelatikKembar↔️0x446bF788446B40Ca07e42fb1986c4366e46302A2 — proof —archive.orgused by Inspiron14 alsoI'm doing such a big for me investigation with several interconnections through blockchain for first time so if there are any mistakes, then please name them. And again, if any hints on how to find more proofs, please share them. I guess there are probably more accounts in this farm, at least we can see that GelatikKembar didn't take part in this campaign, but there are interconnections with his account through blockchain.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.created_time: July 23, 2023, 08:15:56 PMLast edit: July 23, 2023, 08:32:06 PM by YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: jokers10 on July 23, 2023, 07:38:38 PMIf any hints on how to find other accounts of this farm or how to find proofs for accounts that I didn't find interconnections except writing style yet, it would be good.@jokers10, most likely they are Alt, aside from transactional connections, I found quickly the Twitters used by: @CapGelatik and @Inspiron14, both of them are on your inquiry list.Proof:Quote from: CapGelatik on November 18, 2017, 03:43:32 AMweek 8 (13/11-19/11)share post ;- https://www.facebook.com/amelia.damayanti.94849/posts/166549210591463- https://www.facebook.com/amelia.damayanti.94849/posts/166549510591433- https://www.facebook.com/amelia.damayanti.94849/posts/166549637258087- https://www.facebook.com/amelia.damayanti.94849/posts/166549767258074[ Archive ]Quote from: Inspiron14 on February 04, 2018, 02:30:43 PMweek 29/01 - 04/02facebook link ; https://www.facebook.com/amelia.damayanti.94849like & share post;https://www.facebook.com/amelia.damayanti.94849/posts/159116071334777[ Archive ]There are at least two Alt connected via Twitter that they use.Maybe others are the same. the evidence above is strong.No doubt @CapGelatik and @Inspiron14, pure Alt connected, based on the Address they use, 100% both Alt.Additional evidence:Quote from: CapGelatik on April 11, 2018, 06:10:10 AM#JOINBitcointalk username: CapGelatikForum rank: Full MemberPosts count:  479ETH address: 0x6e50e0Cf3A42180F497d44113D7F897313573FB3[ Archive ]Quote from: Inspiron14 on December 30, 2017, 08:47:40 AMhello sir, i joined bounty facebook in your project "fidentiax"sorry, can you change my wallet address, because my old address has been stolen by hackers.username : Inspiron14line spreadsheet : 394new address : 0x6e50e0Cf3A42180F497d44113D7F897313573FB3thanks[ Archive ]

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: I didn't check the connection between the wallets of any of the users you mentioned - but I seem curious about two accounts created on the same day that were potentially alt from the same user. Both usernames appear to have the same characters - that's no coincidence.CapGelatik - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 12:55:48 PMGelatikKembar - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 02:12:58 PM

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on July 23, 2023, 09:04:34 PMCapGelatik - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 12:55:48 PMGelatikKembar - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 02:12:58 PMSaveOurSea - Date Registered: September 28, 2017, 01:34:26 PMSmitty Werben Man Jensen - Last Active: July 17, 2023, 04:11:20 PM - https://archive.ph/PpUmiwaONE - Last Active:July 17, 2023, 04:59:43 PM - https://archive.ph/fXpYICapGelatik - Last Active: July 17, 2023, 05:05:34 PM - https://archive.ph/N6hKlDesscount - Last Active: July 18, 2023, 02:03:23 AM - https://archive.ph/EUlnVInspiron14 - Last Active:   July 18, 2023, 02:04:15 AM  - https://archive.ph/6uv02judaspriest - Last Active: July 18, 2023, 04:57:30 AM - https://archive.ph/PUEatSaveOurSea - Last Active: July 18, 2023, 05:05:14 AM - https://archive.ph/pJoyBlunnatic - Last Active: July 22, 2023, 09:01:52 AM - https://archive.ph/xrs2lAre you guys seeing a pattern? I think this farm might be having more accounts.

comments.author: jokers10
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on July 23, 2023, 11:05:19 PMAre you guys seeing a pattern? I think this farm might be having more accounts.It is very likely. Desscount's account has a tag from icopress about interconnection with now inactive Arcas. And Arcas has multiple tags about that account is bought or hacked. lunnatic has the same couple of tags. So it is possibly a farm of bought or hacked accounts and there could be much more of not found yet.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on July 23, 2023, 09:04:34 PMI didn't check the connection between the wallets of any of the users you mentioned - but I seem curious about two accounts created on the same day that were potentially alt from the same user. Both usernames appear to have the same characters - that's no coincidence.CapGelatik - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 12:55:48 PMGelatikKembar - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 02:12:58 PMIf someone has to cheat by creating many accounts to cheat a campaign, why make the names look similar. There's no how they would have exhausted the combination of 26 alphabets and 10 numbers.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: KingsDen on July 25, 2023, 01:42:36 PMQuote from: _BlackStar on July 23, 2023, 09:04:34 PM-snip-If someone has to cheat by creating many accounts to cheat a campaign, why make the names look similar. There's no how they would have exhausted the combination of 26 alphabets and 10 numbers.Basically those accounts are not created to cheat the same campaign - most likely as an alternative to joining another campaign especially about accounts with similar names. However, over time - this mindset can change, especially if no one is aware of the activity and returns to find no connection between the two. Yesterday I found 3 different accounts created around 2015 [2 Legendary and 1 Hero] - but all 3 didn't join the same campaign or maybe I missed something. The three of them collect a number of bounty campaign results in the form of ETH and BNB in ​​the same wallet - but I don't think that's ever a problem as long as they don't cheat.Of course some cheaters are too stupid or don't realize that the account names they created are too similar to be suspected of being an alt. They can argue - but who wants to believe them after there is a connection between accounts?

comments.author: jokers10
comments.body: I went through another one signature campaign and found some more accounts with the same writing style, but most of accounts I found don't have interconnections through blockchain so I'm not going to name nor these accounts nor the campaign at the moment. But there is one more account connected with those I mentioned in the first post.monineklutakHis main ETH-address is 0xA3C4b0Af1412571b0378cafA82948efBed611633 — proof — archive.orgThis address has transaction to 0xd265BAdCb90b76d283A362AD3A232C3B74AbAd48 and there's a transaction to the same address from 0x1fA2a6A39c240d27B5C3F1C18CD2ae6574F87467 (belongs to Inspiron14 mentioned in the first post — proof —archive.org)And there is another transaction to 0x53625afF45021D961900daDbeb1535b92F2Cd00d, and this address we already know as connected with Inspiron14, lunnatic and Desscount.So now I thought that 0x53625afF45021D961900daDbeb1535b92F2Cd00d is connected to so many accounts. And I looked at all addresses had transactions with it. Some are from forum users.0x53625afF45021D961900daDbeb1535b92F2Cd00d↔️0xCCA942e29bD8B0664F1689979C37e53d4cc918ddpucunghul — proof — archive.orgHas a tag: "Accounts Connected: pucunghul (u=1112518), kiemponxs (u=1093120), colenax (u=1104031)Cheating signature campaign with alt accounts." Ref.↔️0x2087500147D070DeC3187Ad84426CB16858D9e6EDesscount (proof in the first post)Has several tags including: "Linked accounts Bitcointalk: 966189, 111993 - https://imgur.com/hRdomti."↔️0x2873F28e551F270338EA4de73189f7F18e3d141Alunnatic (proof in the first post)Has several tags including: "Hacked/sold account."↔️0xCC4a232e6CD9ADfb89AA62EDc8D38C9E212298E0generous — proof — archive.orgHas several tags including: "Account sales encourage scams, spam, and account farming."↔️0xA3C4b0Af1412571b0378cafA82948efBed611633monineklutak (proof in this post above)Has a tag: "Part of the Spammer Blacklist: this user has made at least 195 replies that are not up to forum standards."↔️0x5bF54a3E37eB1974B64e7257241D6a53faaD2354BladeXX — proof — archive.org↔️0x873A6dE20E76a7C55E0c6e3241553977158deB81Inspiron14 (proof in the first post)↔️0xe95BAD0D7a8d503348366A7A652616c5aa81D42bSungoku — proof — archive.orgHas a tag: "Cheating bounty with alt accounts." Link to proof on interconnection with MasNizzer and Landakhitam.↔️0x43aC11F24873E31D35bc988CD7ebD008eBCED37adewanaga — proof — archive.org↔️0x503b444A2B2d95b501C78D99D2302C75154E0e1dOne single transaction from this address. It is not an address of any forum user, but it is mentioned as an address of a scammed exchange BCNEX. Maybe it was just a buy on this exchange, don't know.Well, I see there are tags about account trading or hacking in some of accounts which are found interconnected, so I suppose this farm can be much much bigger.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: KingsDen on July 25, 2023, 01:42:36 PMQuote from: _BlackStar on July 23, 2023, 09:04:34 PMI didn't check the connection between the wallets of any of the users you mentioned - but I seem curious about two accounts created on the same day that were potentially alt from the same user. Both usernames appear to have the same characters - that's no coincidence.CapGelatik - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 12:55:48 PMGelatikKembar - Date Registered: September 26, 2017, 02:12:58 PMIf someone has to cheat by creating many accounts to cheat a campaign, why make the names look similar. There's no how they would have exhausted the combination of 26 alphabets and 10 numbers.With all evidence shown there's no doubt that the two accounts were alts, but the question to asked the user is that how possible is it for him to have participated in a campaign he took no time in reading the rules, am sure it's a deliberate act to prove that he's wise enough to outsmart the campaign manager, here he has broken two of the rules which are very important to note, using of alts and the use of AI for posting, the two accounts will definitely enough the reward of being tagged red for doing this.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: Quote from: jokers10 on July 30, 2023, 04:13:08 PMLooks like this farm is much bigger than even it looked at first. I guess if to dig deeper there can be probably hundreds of accounts.surprising catch.blockchain transactions from addresses that are used for quite a long time. moreover, the account you added has a history of password changes in 2018, as well as multiple address changes. (I didn't check everything). there is an assumption that the account has changed hands from the previous farm account.it must have taken a lot of your time to check every blockchain transaction of that many accounts. but maybe more accounts are exposed.

comments.author: jokers10
comments.body: Quote from: Pandu Geddon on July 30, 2023, 04:52:23 PMQuote from: jokers10 on July 30, 2023, 04:13:08 PMLooks like this farm is much bigger than even it looked at first. I guess if to dig deeper there can be probably hundreds of accounts.surprising catch.blockchain transactions from addresses that are used for quite a long time. moreover, the account you added has a history of password changes in 2018, as well as multiple address changes. (I didn't check everything). there is an assumption that the account has changed hands from the previous farm account.it must have taken a lot of your time to check every blockchain transaction of that many accounts. but maybe more accounts are exposed.I'm sure there are much more interconnected accounts. And that's right, it takes lot of time both catching and then drawing up a reference post. Dozens of addresses and accounts, many have connections to other accounts, which have further connections. As you can see there are connections with some other investigations which caught some of accounts of this huge farm.Of course there is a probability that there are several farms with account trading between them, but as to me it doesn't matter too much. One farm or several farms but we see cheating, low quality posting, bounty abusing, and even probably scam. If they didn't trash the topics with nonsense I'd hardly start searching, but lots of rubbish instead of discussion makes me a bit disappointed.There probably be more parts in this investigation. Maybe someone will see some idea for own investigation of some interconnections of this farm. But mentioned accounts are surely not the entire list of all accounts of this farm.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: One of the problems associated with finding connected accounts in any situation is that no matter how may you find there could be several more that you never linked or never thought could be related.In many cases, we find a farm and link several accounts but the puppeteer is controlling several other accounts and several other farms (or other farm operators are being mentioned in the Reputation board) which means we are always playing catch-up. Like you I would not be surprised if there were more names to be added to the list you compiled.Quote from: jokers10 on July 30, 2023, 05:21:15 PMThere probably be more parts in this investigation. Maybe someone will see some idea for own investigation of some interconnections of this farm. But mentioned accounts are surely not the entire list of all accounts of this farm.

comments.author: jokers10
comments.body: Quote from: JollyGood on July 30, 2023, 06:56:03 PMOne of the problems associated with finding connected accounts in any situation is that no matter how may you find there could be several more that you never linked or never thought could be related.In many cases, we find a farm and link several accounts but the puppeteer is controlling several other accounts and several other farms (or other farm operators are being mentioned in the Reputation board) which means we are always playing catch-up. Like you I would not be surprised if there were more names to be added to the list you compiled.Quote from: jokers10 on July 30, 2023, 05:21:15 PMThere probably be more parts in this investigation. Maybe someone will see some idea for own investigation of some interconnections of this farm. But mentioned accounts are surely not the entire list of all accounts of this farm.Here we have a farm of accounts which got their ranks prior merit system implementation. So when we catch them, this farmer has less opportunity to take part in signature campaign. So there probably will be less trash in the topics. Of course he has more accounts, but sooner or later he'll face with a situation when he'll need to buy more accounts or to try to make new and to get ranks for them, but it's not as easy. So this still has sense.If we'd talked about newbies and social media bounty participants then it was less practical to waste time on alt accounts as it is easy to make as many new ones as an abuser will like. But signature campaigns is IMO not the same.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: jokers10 on July 30, 2023, 07:12:50 PMIf we'd talked about newbies and social media bounty participants then it was less practical to waste time on alt accounts as it is easy to make as many new ones as an abuser will like. But signature campaigns is IMO not the same.But wait - are you sure you want to spend that much time getting evidence from every suspect account you suspect?I hope you'll actually get what you deserve for your efforts - but I think most of the accounts you mentioned don't seem to care about these accusations, or they just aren't aware of this thread. Neither account has spoken on this thread - clearly showing that their mindset towards this thread is the same.

comments.author: jokers10
comments.body: Quote from: _BlackStar on July 30, 2023, 10:02:33 PMQuote from: jokers10 on July 30, 2023, 07:12:50 PMIf we'd talked about newbies and social media bounty participants then it was less practical to waste time on alt accounts as it is easy to make as many new ones as an abuser will like. But signature campaigns is IMO not the same.But wait - are you sure you want to spend that much time getting evidence from every suspect account you suspect?I hope you'll actually get what you deserve for your efforts - but I think most of the accounts you mentioned don't seem to care about these accusations, or they just aren't aware of this thread. Neither account has spoken on this thread - clearly showing that their mindset towards this thread is the same.No, I'm not sure. But luckily it depends on if I want to do something at the time or not. It's not a job. If I'll feel that I don't want to do something like that I can do what I want, if I will have some time and interest in investigation I can make new part. I'm free to do or not to do. But if there will be less nonsense in topics it is good.As for interest of the farm holder, he probably doesn't want to attract additional attention not to risk too many of his accounts to be revealed additionally.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: OP, could you please help compile the list of all this connected accounts as one so that it's easier to click, tag them and not miss out any like we did in this grand account farm bust?It doesn't have to be detailed, but for just easier follow up.

comments.author: CYBER_COWBOY
comments.created_time: July 31, 2023, 12:28:03 AMLast edit: July 31, 2023, 09:51:51 AM by CYBER_COWBOY
comments.body: What you doing here is really good and it can expose a lot of things! Keep the good job up!  If you feel at anytime you don't have enough time and need help with something, even the easiest and most boring things, hit me up I gladly help you out.I am still a bit new here and would see things without taking any side at all.Cheers / CC.EDIT: If anyone could be kind and have time, could you please tell me how this people that have multiple accounts how they do? How can they have the time for this? They must do this like a full time job and not have a real job? (No I don't want to learn how to do it, I am just curious  ) - sorry if it's to much off topic.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: jokers10 on July 31, 2023, 08:39:18 AM>>snip<<All tagged, apart from the 3 you were not sure about, though I can see some merit connection between one of them but I will like tagged them based on my findings. I think this farm is bigger than we think because some of the accounts I tagged were already tagged for connections with other bounty cheating accounts that have not even been looked at here.Others are already banned. How greedy and determined can some people be to manage such huge account farms?
